intro: Phyllorkis triadenia, commonly known as the Three-lobed Rock Pineapple, is a member of the Bromeliaceae family. It is a small, evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. The plant is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves that are thick, fleshy, and covered in a waxy cuticle. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, emerging from the center of the rosette. The plant is adapted to arid environments and is often found growing on rocky outcrops.
